text: absolutely look at it's called the behavior of individual investors it's by Barbera in Odin I reference this all the time it's an old study it's from 2012 however there are two things I really want to draw your attention to these two right here this study is about the behavior of individual retail investors or Traders it applies to both of the groups and they find a bunch of specific habits that sabotage them these two are important for you and for this video the first one is the tendency to sell winning Investments while holding losing Investments this is called the disposition effect we enjoy the experience of booking a win it affirms our ego we were right we also like making money who doesn't like that the process of taking a winning trade down is so easy and you've also probably heard a lot of really bad information like nobody goes broke by taking profits yeah you actually can you actually can and I'm going to show you how so it's not so much about any one individual trade it's about a system of Trades the process that you follow which we'll talk about the second component here is naive reinforcement this is where we essentially repeat behaviors that we enjoyed and avoid behaviors that we don't like so a behavior like losing a position and closing a losing position that sucks so the propensity is going forward to avoid doing that or the process of really
